title: Battle of Târgu Frumos
text:
The Battle of Târgu Frumos, also known as the Târgu Frumos Operation, occurred during 1944 in <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> in and around the town of <a href="T%C3%A2rgu%20Frumos">Târgu Frumos</a> in <a href="Ia%C5%9Fi%20County">Iaşi County</a>, <a href="Moldavia">Moldavia</a>, <a href="Romania">Romania</a>.
It was fought between <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet</a> forces (the <a href="Red%20Army">Red Army</a>) and <a href="Axis%20powers">Axis</a> forces (the <a href="Nazi%20Germany">German</a> <a href="Wehrmacht">Wehrmacht</a> and <a href="Romania">Romania</a>n forces) and, according to <a href="David%20Glantz">David Glantz</a>, it was within a supposed Soviet Union <a href="First%20Jassy-Kishinev%20Offensive">First Jassy-Kishinev Offensive</a>. The same historian had earlier concluded that the battle was instead a successful example of Soviet "<a href="maskirovka">maskirovka</a>", meant to trick the Germans into believing the region continued to be in their strategic interest after the end of the <a href="Uman%E2%80%93Boto%C8%99ani%20Offensive">Uman–Botoșani Offensive</a>.
The term may apply to either to the entire scope of conflict in the area over a longer time, but often refers specifically to the battle in May. For example, a military unit or an individual can be said to have served in the battle.
Soviet historians did not consider this to be a significant battle but have come around to identifying it separately.
The battle in May has been used in military education as an example of how a mobile defense can defeat an armoured spearhead.
